page.title: 01Cavendish and Glemsford
page.content: Cavendish is a pretty village nestling beside the "River Stour", protected from unsightly development by conservation orders. House prices tend to be beyond the reach of young families and the proportion of the population over state pension age (32%) is increasing. Recently the Butcher and one of the two Grocers have closed, it has to share a rector with the larger village of Clare and the roll of the 120 year old school is decreasing. Its future as a thriving community is uncertain but its "charm" seems certain to survive. In contrast Glemsford is built on top of the hill above the Stour. The village has, and is continuing to grow rapidly. Young families are attracted to cheap housing estates, and older people tend to move out, preserving the population and future of school.
